poem:
Title: "Gloom on the Pearl"

Beneath bitter dragon's breath,
Hong Kong dreams of former swath;
A jewel diminished in its depth,
No respite from Xi Jinping's wrath.

Gone the sway of freedom's song,
Quiet joy withers in his winter;
From the fortress where hearts belong,
In hushed defiance, whispers linger.

So farewell, Hong Kong's lost might,
In your shadow, liberty's tale still resonates;
Sunset meets the once vibrant site,
Yet its spirit, repression never abates.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Lies, ideology and repression: China seals Hong Kong’s failed-state fate | Simon Tisdall So farewell, Hong Kong. The vibrant, pulsating city-state that grew, under British rule, into one of the world’s great financial, business, cultural and tourism hubs has finally been brought to heel. Browbeaten, abused, silenced. Trust Xi Jinping, China’s dementor president, to suck out all the joy. Last Wednesday was the UN’s International Day of Happiness. But it was a sad, bad day". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
